page.title: 02CADBURY - TYPHOO MORETON
page.content: Cadbury's in Moreton opened in 1953, just after the 2nd World War because they thought that after rationing everyone would want sweets. They have three different factories on the site :- tea, Smash (instant potato), chocolate biscuits and cakes. They employ 2500 people, but the amount rises in summer to make things ready for Christmas, making 5 million chocolate fingers a day. 60% of the workforce are women, and they make better packers, having nimble fingers. The potatoes come from America and Holland, cocoa from Africa, tea from Sri Lanka and India. Security is difficult because many people use the sports facilities at weekends. They plan to build a high fence and have video cameras.The site covers 70 acres and is almost a metre below sea level. Sea breezes helps set the chocolate.
